sub_title: Cultural Psychologist | Writer | Scholar of Religion
summary:
Research
As a cultural psychologist as well as a scholar of religion, my academic interests are scattered across both the social sciences and the humanities. They include religious and aesthetic experiences, mysticism, meaning-making, creativity, rituality and magical thinking, and also cultural transmission, evolutionary psychology, ecological approaches (embodied embedded cognition), identity construction, consciousness, religious self-legitimation, and human atmospheres.

I also have an interest in psychoanalysis, philosophy of science, theory and method. My research skills range from quantitative methods in general to qualitative ones—such as interviewing, participatory observation, and content analysis—in particular. I am currently involved in two research projects: one on religious self-legitimation (together with Leonard van ‘t Hul), and one on human atmospheres.

Teaching
I have extensive experience in teaching, developing teaching material, and coordinating courses in both the social sciences and the humanities (most notably cultural psychology, psychology of religion and religious studies). I have taught both undergraduate and graduate students at university and at the first, second, and last year at college (‘hogeschool’) level. I have taught regular students as well as adult learners and have done so in Dutch and English.

The teaching formats of the courses I participated in range from individual supervision (more than 120 undergraduate and graduate theses) to practicals, seminars (of 10-30 students), and lectures (up to 120 students). Apart from the development of course material, I have constructed and validated exams, edited readers, wrote syllabi and for several years coordinated two courses of some 450 students each. As part of these activities, I have supervised teaching assistants and junior lecturers and offered them didactic training, intervision sessions, and personal guidance in the form of class visitations and one-on-one coaching.

Style
Co-workers and students describe me as (see testimonials):
•	enthusiastic and energetic
•	knowledgeable
•	approachable and reliable
•	loyal and critical

education.degree_name: Internschip (as part of my MSc project)

awards.title: Interview 'Helpen is sterk' about prosocial behaviour with Milou van Hintum
awards.description:
"Gisteren en vandaag hebben 300 duizend vrijwilligers gehoor gegeven aan de oproep van het Oranje Fonds om hun handen uit de mouwen te steken. Aan de actie 'NL DOET' doen dit jaar twee keer zo veel mensen mee als vorig jaar. 'Het feit dat je iets voor een ander doet, is een bewijs van je eigen kracht,' zegt cultuurpsycholoog Léon van Gulik (Radboud Universiteit Nijmegen)."

Continue reading at http://www.volkskrant.nl/vk/nl/2844/Archief/archief/article/detail/1862250/2011/03/19/Helpen-is-sterk.dhtml

authors.headline: Cultural Psychologist | Writer | Scholar of Religion

profile_positions.description: As a guest researcher at Leiden University, I currently deal with topics like religious creativity, self-legitimation, and identity formation in neo-Paganism. Apart from these topics, I am interested in (human) atmospheres, magical thinking, religious experiences and the development of theory and methods.
profile_positions.title: Honorary Research Fellow - Humanities Faculty

profile_positions.description: For the 2021-2022 academic year, I offered the courses Sociology of Religion and New Religions. In addition, I will develop and offer the new course Practicing Religious Studies.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Professor Religious Studies Ad Interim (Social Sciences of Religion)

profile_positions.description: For the Leiden University Centre for the Study of Religion (LUCSoR) at the Faculty of Humanities, I offered the redeveloped courses 'Psychology and Religion' and 'Methods and Techniques 3: Quantitative Research. In addition, I was an advisor for BA and MA-candidates.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Professor Religious Studies Ad Interim (Psychology of Religion)

profile_positions.description:
In 1998 I debuted as a freelance writer, contributing an essay, to the Dutch journal Prana. I published a second essay in 2000.

Since 2016 I have been involved in various publications on communication skills. Most notably, I contributed as a co-author to the textbook 'Leren Communiceren' (7th ed., 2016), published by Noordhoff. For that edition, I also made the index. For the coming edition, I fully updated and revised the index. In 2018, I copyedited the book 'Gespreksvoering voor Sociaal Werkers,' also published by Noordhoff.

Apart from writing and copyediting, since 2010, I also regularly serve as a peer reviewer for various international academic journals. These include the Pomegranate, Religions, the International Journal of Latin American Religions, Sexes, Human Arenas and the Journal for the Study of Religion, Nature, and Culture.
profile_positions.title: Writer and Editor

profile_positions.description: At Leiden University I offered and redeveloped the courses Psychology & Religion and Methods & Techniques 3: Quantitative Research, I also lectured The Future of Religion in the West and New Religions.
profile_positions.title: Senior Lecturer Religious Studies Ad Interim (Social Sciences of Religion)

profile_positions.description: At Groningen University I offered and co-developed the course Psychology of Religion together with Dr Anja Visser.
profile_positions.title: Senior Lecturer Religious Studies Ad Interim (Psychology of Religion)

company.name: Hogeschool Inholland / Inholland University of Applied Sciences

profile_positions.description: I was a coordinator of the study coach program and of the teaching trajectory of communication and research at the Department of Safety and Security Management, which is a part of the Faculty of Law, Business and Finance, Inholland University of Applied Sciences in Rotterdam. In addition, I acted as a thesis adviser and offered the courses Psychology and Sociology, Organizational Psychology, Study Skills (year 1), Study Skills (year 2), Argumentation, The Social Science of the City, and Multiculturality.
profile_positions.title: College Lecturer of Safety and Security Management (Communication and Social Sciences)

profile_positions.description: I was an external (i.e., self-funded) PhD-candidate working on my self-initiated research project on religious creativity in Wicca, Moongazers & Trailblazers, advised by Wouter van Beek and Rien van Uden. I successfully defended my thesis on 31 May 2017.
profile_positions.title: External PhD-candidate

profile_positions.description: For the Faculty of Humanities, Department of Religious Studies, I offer the self-written course Religion, Spirituality and Subjectivity as a temporary lecturer (until the end of May).
profile_positions.title: Senior Lecturer Religious Studies Ad Interim (Psychology of Religion)

company.name: Hogeschool van Amsterdam | Amsterdam University of Applied Sciences

profile_positions.description: Apart from teaching the courses Observation and Interpretation, Research Methods | and II, Interview Skills, Psychological Cases, Freshmen and Sophomore  Projects, I developed the courses Religion, Philosophy and Psychology, Writing Skills and Research Skills II. I have also supervised 13 bachelor students.
profile_positions.title: College Lecturer of Applied Psychology (Communication and Methodology)

profile_positions.description: I currently coordinate the freshman course 'Introduction Person', I teach the second year's courses 'Psychology of Morality', 'Religion explained?', and 'Culture and behaviour', and  in the third year I am an advisor to eight Bachelr students. In the past I have taught the courses 'Psychology of Magic', 'Bachelor thesis Psychlogy of Culture and Religion', 'Bachelor thesis Developmental Psychology' (in part), and have advised the theses of over 100 BSc candiates students and two MSc candidates.
profile_positions.title: University Lecturer of Psychology (Cultural Psychology, Developmental Psychology, Gen. Psychology)

profile_positions.description: I tutored the courses 'Academic Skill of Psychologists', 'Research training for Psychologists 1', 'Practical Developmental Psychology' and 'Psychology of Morality'; I offered 'Psychology of Magic' (in part) and 'Bachelorthesis Cultural Psychology and Psychology of Religion'.
profile_positions.title: Junior Lecturer of Psychology (Cultural Psychology, Developmental Psychology, General Psychology)

profile_positions.description: I assisted in the courses: 'Computer Skills for Psychologists 1', 'Cultural Psychology', 'Practical Developmental Psychology', 'Personality Psychology', 'Self and Culture', 'Practical Research Methods for Cultural Psychology and Psychology of Religion', 'Psychology of Magic', Psychology of Mysticism', and 'The Multicultural Society from a Psychological Perspective'.
profile_positions.title: Assistant
